page.shortlink: UX Control Field Properties Validation Javascript
page.description: Only available if Immediate validation is set to 'Client-side only' or 'Client-side and Server-side'. Specify Javascript to validate the data in the field. Client-side validation is very fast because it does not require making an Ajax callback to the server. Your Javascript code can use the 'data' variable name to refer to the current value in the control. Your code should include a 'return' statement that returns true or a string with an error message. For example: *[js:return true;]* (no error) or *[js:return 'Value is not valid.';]* (if there is an error.)

section.title: Use Validation Javascript to Limit the Length of a Zip Code

step.description: In the UX Builder on the UX Controls page open the 'Data Controls' menu. Click on the [TextBox] option to add a textbox control to the component. Give the textbox control the name and label 'zip'.
Highlight the textbox control. In the properties list on the right click on the [...] button next to the 'Validation rules' property in the Field Properties section.
In the 'Text Format' section check the 'Allow digits' checkbox. Click OK.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Validation Javascript' property.
Add the following code to the 'Javascript for Client-side Validation of UX Control' dialog, then click OK.
Open 'Defined Controls' menu. Click on the 'Submit-Reset' option to add submit and reset buttons to the component.
Run the component in Live Preview. Enter a number that is not 5 digits long, then click the 'Submit' button. The error message you defined should appear.
Enter a 5 digit zip code into the textbox and click 'Submit'. The error message should go away.
